title: n8n Overview
description: Monitor n8n workflow automation performance, health, and resource utilization.

definition.content:
# n8n Workflow Automation

This dashboard provides comprehensive observability for your n8n instance, including:
- Workflow execution metrics
- Queue job performance
- Cache efficiency
- Node.js runtime health
- System resource utilization

# Useful Links

[Github Repo](https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n)

[n8n official documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/)

[n8n home page](https://n8n.io/)

At-a-glance health status of your n8n deployment. Use the monitor widget to track alert states, and the summary metrics to identify instances with high queue backlogs, elevated failure rates, or unusual workflow activity.

Track workflow execution success and failure rates to identify problematic workflows. Use the execution duration charts to detect performance regressions, and the workflow breakdown to pinpoint which workflows need optimization or debugging.

Monitor cache efficiency to optimize n8n performance. A low hit rate indicates potential memory pressure or misconfiguration. Track hits vs misses over time to validate caching improvements and identify cache invalidation patterns.

Monitor the background job queue for scaling decisions. High waiting durations or growing queue depths signal the need for additional workers. Use job completion rates and processing times to ensure SLAs are met for time-sensitive workflows.

Diagnose Node.js runtime performance issues. Event loop lag indicates blocking operations affecting responsiveness. Monitor heap usage and GC frequency to detect memory leaks or tune memory limits for optimal throughput.

Analyze API traffic patterns and performance. Use request rate trends for capacity planning, and response time percentiles to identify slow endpoints. Monitor error rates to catch integration issues with external services or webhook failures.

Monitor n8n's internal event bus for workflow triggers and inter-node communication. Track message throughput to ensure events are processed without delays, and watch for backlogs that could indicate downstream bottlenecks.

Track system-level resource consumption across n8n instances. Monitor CPU and memory usage for capacity planning, and use uptime metrics to detect unexpected restarts or stability issues that could affect workflow reliability.
Stream n8n application logs filtered by severity. Use error and warning logs to troubleshoot workflow failures, and correlate log timestamps with metric anomalies for root cause analysis.
